cab.content: SECRET.WAR CABINET, 88,Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Downing Street, on Tuesday," March G, 191.7, at 11 a.jr.Present:The Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. the Earl Curzon 'of kedleston, K.G., G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.The Right Hon. the Viscount Milner,G.C.B., G.C.M.G.The Right Hon. A. Bonar Law, M.P.The following were also present: The Rio-ht Hon. Sir Robert Borden,G.C.M.G., K.C., M. P., Premier of Canada.The Hon. Sir George H. Perley,K.C.M.G., Minister of Overseas Military-Forces of Canada.The Right Hon. W. F. Massey, P.C.,Premier of New Zealand.The Right Hon. Sir J. G. Ward, Bart.,P.O,, K C.M.G., Minister of Finance,&c, New Zealand.The Right Hon. Sir Edward P. Morris,P.C., K.C.M.G., Premier of Newfound-land.The Right Hon. A. J. Balfour, O.M., M.P.,Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs..The Right Hon. the Lord Hardinge ofPens hurst, K.G., G.C.B., G.C.S.I.,G.C.MG, G.C.I.E., G.C.V.O., I.S.O.,Permanent Under Secretary of State forForeiga Affairs.H. C. M. Lambert, Esq., C.B., ColonialOffice.The Right Hon. the Earl of Derby, K.G.,G.C.V.O., C.B., Secretary of State forWar.General Sir W. R. Robertson, G.C.B.,K.C.V.O., D.S.O., Chief of the ImperialGeneral Staff.Lieutenant-General Sir H. H. Wilson,K.C.B., D.S.O. (for Minute 2).The Right Hon. Sir E. Carson, K.C.,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.Admiral Sir J. R. Jellicoe, G.C.B., O.M.,G.C.V.O., First Sea Lord of theAdmiralty.The Right Hon. A. Chamberlain, M.P.,Secretary of State for India (for minute 2).The Right Hon. W. Long, M.P., Secretaryof State for the Colonies.The Right Hon. C. Addison, M.D., M.P.,Minister of Munitions (for Minute 2).W. T. Layton, Esq., Ministry of Munitions(for Minute 2),Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M. P. A. Hankey, K.C.B., Secretary.Major C. L. Storr, Assistant Secretary.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir Mark Sykes, Bart., M P., Assistant Secretary.Printed for the War Cabinet. March 1917. German raider. 1. THE First Sea Lord reported that information had been , *received . from the Commander-in-Chief, East Indies, that HisMajesty's sloop " Odin" had captured a German prize crew incharge of the oiler " Turritella," which had been captured by aGerman raider and was reported by the Chinese crew 1o have laid mines off Aden. The English members of the crew of the" Turritella " had been taken prisoners on board the raider.The First Sea Lord stated that the sailing of troopships in theEastern seas had been temporarily suspended, but that 18,000 troops were actually now at sea,The Conference in 2. Lord Milner made a report to the War Cabinet on theEussia.* principal general results of the recent Allied Conference in Russia.Lieutenant-General Sir H. H. Wilson and Mr. W. T. Laytonalso made statements on the military and munitions situationsrespectively in Russia.(Initialled) D. LI. G.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,March 6, 1917.* A Memornndum by Lord Milner giving full details of his recent visit to russia is now approaching completion, and will, it is hoped, be ready for circulation in thecourse of the next day or two.
